feed.title: Early Buzz: Tom Cruise, Kaley Cuoco, Lindsay Lohan and More
feed.subtitle: The guests at Vanity Fair's Oscar after-party let loose in the event's photo booth, an annual tradition that elicits delightfully childish candid poses from Hollywood's elite.

link.title: Early Buzz: Tom Cruise, Kaley Cuoco, Lindsay Lohan and More

link.Abstract: Get the latest celebrity news, photos and video
link.title: Get the latest celebrity news, photos and video

link.Abstract: In today's edition, a Snooki sighting sparks belly bump speculation.
link.title: Blog: Scandal Sheet
Follow Dose.ca on Twitter

content.div:
Vanity Fair set up a photo booth at their Oscars after-party, and just released some adorable shots of Tom Cruise, Katie Holmes, Emma Stone, Kristen Wiig and more. Good to see we're not the only ones whose go-to pose is fish face.

--

It looks like Big Bang Theory star Kaley Cuoco's relationship just exploded. She's called off her engagement to Josh Resnik.

--

Sorry, Interwebs. Both Christina Hendricks and Olivia Munn's reps have said those nude photos of the actresses that surfaced this weekend are fake.

--

Lindsay Lohan didn't completely embarrass herself on SNL this weekend, mostly because the writers didn't give her much to do. Her episode managed to score the second highest ratings of the season. Watch her opening monologue here.

--

Community is returning to NBC's schedule March 15, but fans can enjoy a web-only, three-part animated short a week earlier. This calls for a celebration dance!

--

Rapper Young Buck somehow emerged unscathed after 11 bullets were fired at his SUV on Sunday morning.

--

On this week's TV podcast, we're chatting about Revenge, Gossip Girl and The Real Housewives of Vancouver.

--

The Hunger Games mall tour has begun!

--

Hawaii Five-0's Alex O'Loughlin is the latest star to check into rehab.

--

Barry Manilow, Celine Dion, Wayne Newton and...Cee-Lo Green? The Voice judge just landed a residency in Las Vegas.

--

During a sit-down on Piers Morgan Tonight that aired Friday, Growing Pains star Kirk Cameron called homosexuality "destructive to so many of the foundations of civilization." Statements like that have GLAAD fuming.

--

Want to know the secret to superior song-clapping? Let The Shins show you!

--

Kim, Kourtney and Khlo√© Kardashian have been named in a $5 million lawsuit connected to the diet pills they shill.

--

Now that she's reportedly pregnant (and engaged!), Snooki is planning a complete personality makeover. If only she could have gotten knocked up years ago...

--

More bad news for fans of Cougar Town: Dan Byrd has just been cast in Louis C.K.'s new CBS comedy.

--

The Desperate Housewives lawsuit is more exciting than anything that's happened on that show in years. Nicollette Sheridan was ordered to "calm down" after her outburst on the witness stand Friday.

--

Is that a baby bump Vanessa Minnillo is trying to hide with her giant purse? (Update: Nick Lachey just confirmed the news on today's Live! with Kelly.)

--

Oprah just landed a big "get" for her struggling OWN network: the first interview with Bobbi Kristina Brown after mother Whitney Houston's death.

--

Check back with Dose.ca throughout the day for your entertainment fix.
